CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper June 23, 1945, pg. 13, reads: "What Fun to be Young! - Favorite stamping grounds for children of the vicinity is the spacious and modernly equipped playground at Irene Kaufmann Settlement. The scene here depicts a typical afternoon at the play center. Children of various races and religious creeds play together at IKS, not yet contaminated with prejudice and bias with which many adults of today are afflicted. The want only to be happy, to laugh and play. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Children playing on slides and swing set in yard of Irene Kaufmann Settlement, Hill District
